name: Tryamour

attributes.attribute: traded wealth for sex with Launfal
made one demand: that he never boast about her
was unable to fulfill his promise
was less punitive than others of her race
permitted to join Tryamour in the Otherworld

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: A Fairy Lover named Tryamour is a heroine in Arthurian tales. In Marie de France's poetry, she exchanged wealth for sexual intercourse with the knight Launfal but, typically, requested that he never brag about their encounter. Launfal, as is common in such scenarios, broke his promise; nevertheless, Tryamour was less severe than other magical beings and allowed Launfal to accompany her in the Otherworld.
